sentences.sContent: We met, the Scotsman and I, one summer at the Edinburgh Festival.
sentences.sContent_eng: We met, the Scotsman and I, one summer at the Edinburgh Festival.
sentences.sCn: 在爱丁堡艺术节的一个夏天，我与那个苏格兰人相遇了。

sentences.sContent: Founded by the Scotsman David Dunbar Buick in 1899, the upscale Buick brand was the first marketed by what would eventually become General Motors.
sentences.sContent_eng: Founded by the Scotsman David Dunbar Buick in 1899, the upscale Buick brand was the first marketed by what would eventually become General Motors.
sentences.sCn: 由苏格兰人大卫·邓巴·别克于1899年创立，别克这个高端的品牌是由如今的通用公司首先投入市场的。

sentences.sContent: The Scotsman William "Captain" Kidd seizes his biggest prize, the loot-laden Armenian ship Cara Merchant, off the coast of India.
sentences.sContent_eng: The Scotsman William "Captain" Kidd seizes his biggest prize, the loot-laden Armenian ship Cara Merchant, off the coast of India.
sentences.sCn: 苏格兰人“船长基德”抓住了他人生中最大的一笔横财，印度附近海域中装满了战利品的美国船“加拉商人”号。
